policy.title: Policy Wide Coverages
policy.bodily-injury-description: Helps pay for injuries caused by you or a covered driver if you get in a car accident.
policy.property-damage-description: Helps pay for damages to other people’s property when you or a covered driver cause an accident.
policy.personal-injury-description: Covers you and your passengers’ medical bills. It also pays for things like lost wages and other nonmedical costs.
policy.uninsured-bodily-injury-description: Covers you and the people in your car for medical bills and related expenses if you're in an accident caused by someone who is uninsured, underinsured, or a hit-and-run.
policy.uninsured-property-damage-description: Covers damages to your car if someone hits you and is uninsured, underinsured, or a hit-and-run.
policy.comprehensive-coverage-description: Covers different types of losses that are usually not the result of driving the vehicle. Think stolen car, hail, an unlucky animal, or fallen trees—something other than collision.
policy.collision-coverage-description: Covers your car’s repair or replacement if it’s damaged in a driving accident with another vehicle or object, such as a tree or a wall. You pay the deductible, we’ll cover the rest.
policy.rental-reimbursement-description: Pays for you to rent a car if yours is stolen or being repaired after an accident where a claim has been filed.

claim.welcome-header:
Had an incident?
We’re here to help
claim.welcome-subheader: Please make sure you are in a safe place before starting.

process.step-1-body: Answer the questions in detail and submit the claim
process.step-2-body: Within 1 business day your assigned claims adjuster will follow up about your submission
process.subcontent: Want to file over the phone?

intro.subheader-1: In the first section you’ll be asked...
intro.step-1-body: Let us know about the incident location, the driver and vehicle, and a description of what happened.
intro.subheader-2: The information we’ll gather now is...
intro.step-2-body: Next, indicate if anyone sought out medical attention from your vehicle or other vehicles.
intro.step-3-body: Up next, describe the passengers in your vehicle and any other vehicles involved in the incident
intro.step-4-body: Detail any damage to your vehicle, if other vehicles were damaged, as well as any property damage
intro.step-5-body: Lastly, were police involved? Any witnesses? As well, optionally provide additional information

0.text: Are you at the scene of the incident?
Please confirm the date, time and location are correct.
0.sub: You can change the information below

0.text: Please provide a description of the incident.
0.sub:
A claims adjuster will follow up so a brief
description will do

0.text: Were you the driver in the incident?
Which driver was involved in this incident?
0.sub: If the driver is not listed please select ‘other’

0.text: Please provide the driver’s name and contact.
0.sub: You can change the information below

0.text: Which vehicle %{driver} driving?
0.sub: You can change the information below

0.text: What is the year, make and model of the vehicle?
Is everyone in %{driver} %{vehicle} okay?
0.sub: Has anyone complained of pain or needed to seek medical treatment?

0.text: Was anyone outside of %{driver} %{vehicle} injured?
0.sub: Includes pedestrians, passengers), or other drivers outside of your vehicle that indicated pain or sought treatment from a first responder

0.text: How many passengers were in the vehicle?
Name(s) and contact of the passenger(s)
0.sub: Note: providing the phone number is optional

0.text: How many other vehicles were involved in the incident?
Please add the details about the other vehicles involved in the incident.
0.sub:
Include:
•Make/Model/Year
•Insurance Carrier
•Policy Number
•Driver’s Name and Phone Number

0.text: Is there damage to %{driver} %{vehicle}?
Please describe the damage to %{driver} %{vehicle}.
Was %{driver} %{vehicle} towed?
Please provide the tow company’s name and number.
Was there damage to any of the other vehicles? (Optional)
0.sub: This could be from dented bumper, shattered window, and/or broken head lights, etc.

0.text: Please provide a description of the damage caused to the other vehicles involved. (Optional)
Was there any physical property damaged outside of the vehicle(s) involved?
0.sub: For example, a lightpole, a fence, a traffic sign, etc.

0.text: What property was damaged? (Optional)
Please provide the property owner’s name and number. (Optional)
Was the location of the property damage the same as the accident location?
What was the location of the property damaged?
Did police respond to the scene?
Please provide the police department and report number.
Were there any witnesses to the accident?
Please provide the witness name and their contact information.
Please provide any other information you would like to share about the incident here. (Optional)
Please provide any photos or videos about the incident here. (Optional)
0.sub: This can help us accurately assess your claim

final.subheader:
LOOP is working hard on your claim.
 Next you will hear from your claims adjuster within 1 business day

welcome.welcome-title: Welcome to LOOP! Let's get going
welcome.welcome-sub-title: All drivers need to use the LOOP app to stay insured. Check your texts for a link to get started.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.need-app-title: Do I need the LOOP App to be a Member?
faq.need-app-info: Yep. You’ll get instant access to all your account info, proof of insurance, Customer Care, and better driving tips. Every driver on your policy needs to download and use the app for at least 21 days a month, which allows us to provide fair and competitive rates based solely on your driving history. That said, you can absolutely turn off app tracking when you are only a passenger and not driving by going to the LOOP App.
faq.why-app-title: Why do I need the LOOP app?
faq.why-app-info: LOOP puts the power of driving in your hands by empowering you with real-time stats, insights, and suggestions on your journey. Most importantly, having the LOOP app on while driving allows to collect the data we need to give you the best possible price when your policy renews.
faq.rate-app-title: How does having the app affect my rate?
faq.rate-app-info: The app helps us factor in the kind of driving habits that can directly impact your vehicle and your overall safety. When your policy renews, we take a look at this data and adjust your premium accordingly. Are you an awesome driver who is always safe? That could mean big savings on your renewal policy's premium!
